channel.title: Workshop-2023s on New Approaches for Extracting Heterogeneous Reference Data
channel.description: Recent content in Workshop-2023s on New Approaches for Extracting Heterogeneous Reference Data

item.title: Call for Papers
item.description: Workshop at the Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory (mpilhlt), 15/16 May, 2023 Organized by: Christian Boulanger, mpilhlt Frankfurt Robin Haunschild mpgivs-cpt Stuttgart Malte Vogl, mpiwg Berlin Andreas Wagner, mpilhlt Frankfurt in cooperation with: Anastasiia Iurshina, Excite/Outcite, University of Stuttgart Clemens Neudecker, SBB Berlin Silvio Peroni, OpenCitations.net Matteo Romanello, EPFL Lausanne Summary Extracting heterogeneous references from texts, in particular from historical documents and humanities or legal scholarship is an unresolved problem.

item.title: Programme
item.description: Workshop at the Max Planck Institute for Legal History and Legal Theory (mpilhlt), 15/16 May, 2023 The programme will be posted here as soon as it is available.
